item.title: Dieter Brummer: Home and Away actor dies aged 45
item.description: Brummer famously played Shane Parrish - Melissa George's love interest on the TV soap in the 1990s.

item.title: Noel Clarke: women make claims to police against the actor
item.description: Police confirm "a number of women" have come forward with more allegations against actor Noel Clarke

item.title: Ronan Keating accepts phone hacking damages
item.description: The ex-Boyzone singer's lawyers told the High Court of the distress caused by newspapers stories.

item.title: Pink offers to pay bikini bottoms fine for Norway women's handball team
item.description: The Norway women's side were last week fined for wearing shorts instead of bikini bottoms in a match.

item.title: Tramlines 2021: Musicians 'overwhelmed' as festival returns
item.description: Organisers say it was "incredible" to see people back with their friends, enjoying the music.

item.title: AKO Caine Prize: Meron Hadero named first Ethiopian winner
item.description: Judges praised Meron Hadero's short story The Street Sweep which ends in a "clever twist".

item.title: Standon Calling festival-goers make most of mud as heavy rain hits
item.description: Organisers of the festival call it off due to flooding and risk of lightning.

item.title: Latitude festival: Magical, emotional... and a little bit frightening
item.description: Bands and fans describe the atmosphere at the UK's first full-capacity festival since 2019.

item.title: Amy Winehouse: Could there be new music on the way?
item.description: Ten years after her death, Amy's parents say they want fans to hear CDs of her unreleased material.

item.title: Anne-Marie: I've always loved the idea of revenge
item.description: The pop star on beating anxiety, growing bored of her biggest song, and her revenge fantasies.

item.title: Benin Bronzes: Nigeria dispute jeopardises return of artefacts
item.description: Several museums in Europe have talked of returning the looted artefacts - but where will they be housed in Nigeria?

item.title: Halima Aden and Tommy Hilfiger: ‘It’s not just about diverse catwalks’
item.description: The world’s first hijab-wearing supermodel talks to fashion designer Tommy Hilfiger about why she quit the industry.

item.title: Latitude 2021: What being a Covid test event means for the festival
item.description: The festival in Suffolk will be the first major event following the lifting of most restrictions.

item.title: Archibald Prize: 100 years of Australia's top portrait honour
item.description: Over 100 years, the Archibald Prize has become better at reflecting Australian diversity.

item.title: Afrobeats in Japan: British-Nigerian hip hop dancer teaching children how to dance
item.description: Yinka Oshiletu, a British-Nigerian hip hop dancer is bringing Afrobeats sounds to Japan's young dancers.

item.title: From lockdown animations to Snoop Dogg music video
item.description: After his homemade animations went viral, Snoop Dogg asked Peter Quinn to direct his new video.

item.title: 10 years on: Amy's parents on new documentary
item.description: The late singer's father says he hopes a new documentary will show a "more rounded image" of Amy.

item.title: England nightclubs reopen: Cheers and celebrations as clubbers return for first night out
item.description: For some revellers in Leeds, this was the first time they'd ever been to a nightclub.

item.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories: Why Hollywood stars like Ryan Reynolds are lining up
item.description: Other stars to have taken part include Tom Hardy, Dolly Parton and Sir Elton John. Here's why.
